text: What is Git?
Which command is used to create a new branch in Git?
What command is used to view the commit history in Git?
How do you discard changes in the working directory that are not staged for commit?
What is the purpose of the .gitignore file?
options: To list files and directories that should be ignored by Git
correctAnswer: To list files and directories that should be ignored by Git

text: Which Git command is used to combine the changes from one branch into another?
What is the purpose of the command 'git stash'?
options: To temporarily store changes that are not ready to be committed
correctAnswer: To temporarily store changes that are not ready to be committed

text: How do you remove a file from the staging area in Git?
What is the purpose of the command 'git clone'?
options: To download a copy of an existing repository
correctAnswer: To download a copy of an existing repository

text: What is a Git repository?
options: A collection of files and directories managed by Git
A remote server hosting your code
correctAnswer: A collection of files and directories managed by Git

text: What does the command 'git pull' do?
options: It pushes changes from a local branch to a remote branch
It fetches changes from a remote repository and merges them into the current branch
correctAnswer: It fetches changes from a remote repository and merges them into the current branch

text: How do you create a new commit in Git?
What is the purpose of the command 'git fetch'?
options: To upload changes to a remote repository
To download changes from a remote repository
correctAnswer: To download changes from a remote repository

text: How do you rename a file in Git?
What is a Git merge conflict?
options: When two or more branches have diverged and changes cannot be automatically merged
When a file is deleted from the repository
When changes are staged for commit
correctAnswer: When two or more branches have diverged and changes cannot be automatically merged

text: What is the purpose of the command 'git remote'?
options: To add a new remote repository

text: How do you create a new tag in Git?
What is the purpose of the command 'git log'?
options: To show the changes between commits

text: How do you undo the last commit in Git?
What is the purpose of the command 'git branch -d <branch>'?
How do you view the differences between two branches in Git?
What does the command 'git push -u origin <branch>' do?
options: It updates the local repository with changes from the remote repository
It uploads changes from the local repository to the remote repository
It sets the upstream branch for the local branch
It pulls changes from the remote repository
correctAnswer: It sets the upstream branch for the local branch

text: How do you revert a commit that has already been pushed to a remote repository?
What is the purpose of the command 'git cherry-pick'?
options: To merge changes from one branch to another
To discard changes in the working directory
correctAnswer: To merge changes from one branch to another

text: How do you create a new branch and switch to it in one command in Git?
